data.quote: Rules of society are nothing  one's conscience is the umpire.
data.author: Madame Dudevant

data.quote: No matter how lovesick a woman is  she shouldn't take the first pill that comes along.
data.author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

data.quote: Form the habit of making decisions when your spirit is fresh ... to let dark moods lead is like choosing cowards to command armies.
data.author: Charles Horton Cooley

data.quote: One must either accept some theory or else believe one's own instinct or follow the world's opinion.
data.author: Gertrude Stein

data.quote: Decide which is the line of conduct that presents the fewest drawbacks and then follow it out as being the best one  because one never finds anything perfectly pure and unmixed  or exempt from danger.
data.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

data.quote: A problem clearly stated is a problem half solved.
data.author: Dorothea Brande

data.quote: We must make the choices that enable us to fulfill the deepest capacities of our real selves.
data.author: Thomas Merton

data.quote: Choose always the way that seems the best  however rough it may be  custom will soon render it easy and agreeable.
data.author: Pythagoras

data.quote: Where an opinion is general  it is usually correct.
data.author: Jane Austen

data.quote: In forty hours I shall be in battle  with little information  and on the spur of the moment will have to make the most momentous decisions. But I believe that one's spirit enlarges with responsibility and that  with God's help  I shall make them  and make them right.
data.author: General George S. Patton

data.quote: Once the "what" is decided  the "how" always follows. We must not make the "how" an excuse for not facing and accepting the "what."
data.author: Pearl S. Buck

data.quote: In each action we must look beyond the action at our past  present and future state  and at others whom it affects  and see the relation of all those things. And then we shall be very cautious.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: One's mind has a way of making itself up in the background  and it suddenly becomes clear what one means to do.
data.author: Arthur Christopher Benson

data.quote: Not all of your decisions will be correct. None of us is perfect. But if you get into the habit of making decisions  experience will develop your judgment to a point where more and more of your decisions will be right. After all  it is better to be right 51 percent of the time and get something done  than it is to get nothing done because you fear to reach a decision.
data.author: H. W. Andrews

data.quote: Decide on what you think is right  and stick to it.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: Continually one faces the horrible matter of making decisions. The solution ... is  as far as possible  to avoid conscious rational decisions and choices  simply to do what you find yourself doing  to float in the great current of life with as little friction as possible  to allow things to settle themselves  as indeed they do with the most infallible certainty.
data.author: Christopher Morley

data.quote: When making a decision of minor importance  I have always found it advantageous to consider all the pros and cons. In vital matters  however  such as the choice of a mate or a profession  the decision should come from the unconscious  from somewhere within ourselves. In the important decisions of personal life  we should be governed  I think  by the deep inner needs of our nature.
data.author: Sigmund Freud

data.quote: Pick battles big enough to matter  small enough to win.
data.author: Jonathan Kozel

data.quote: Wisdom consists in being able to distinguish among dangers and make a choice of the least harmful.
data.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

data.quote: I think we should follow a simple rule: if we can take the worst  take the risk.
data.author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

data.quote: Human foresight often leaves its proudest possessor only a choice of evils.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: When one bases his life on principle  99 percent of his decisions are already made.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The best we can do is size up the chances  calculate the risks involved  estimate our ability to deal with them  and then make our plans with confidence.
data.author: Henry Ford

data.quote: In case of doubt  decide in favor of what is correct.
data.author: Karl Kraus

data.quote: Each man must for himself alone decide what is right and what is wrong  which course is patriotic and which isn't. You cannot shirk this and be a man. To decide against your conviction is to be an unqualified and inexcusable traitor  both to yourself and to your country  let men label you as they may.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: People "died" all the time. ... Parts of them died when they made the wrong kinds of decisions-decisions against life. Sometimes they died bit by bit until finally they were just living corpses walking around. If you were perceptive you could see it in their eyes  the fire had gone out ... you always knew when you made a decision against life. ... The door clicked and you were safe inside- safe and dead.
data.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

data.quote: What I emphasize is for people to make choices based not on fear  but on what really gives them a sense of fulfillment.
data.author: Pauline Rose Chance

data.quote: We lose the fear of making decisions  great and small  as we realize that should our choice prove wrong we can  if we will  learn from the experience.
data.author: Bill W.

data.quote: History is a stern judge.
data.author: Svetlana Alliluyeva

data.quote: I get a little angry about this highhanded scrapping of the look of things. What else have we to go by? How else can the average person form an opinion of a girl's sense of values or even of her chastity except by the looks of her conduct?
data.author: Margaret Culkin Banning

data.quote: You wouldn't want to be caught wearing cheap perfume  would you? Then why do you want to wear cheap perfume on your conduct?
data.author: Margaret Culkin Banning

data.quote: The difference between weakness and wickedness is much less than people suppose  and the consequences are nearly always the same.
data.author: Lady Marguerite Blessington

data.quote: Authority without wisdom is like a heavy axe without an edge  fitter to bruise than to polish.
data.author: Anne Bradstreet

data.quote: One faces the future with one's past.
data.author: Pearl S. Buck

data.quote: Our deeds still travel with us from afar  and what we have been makes us what we are.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: You must not change one thing  one pebble  one grain of sand  until you know what good and evil will follow on that act.
data.author: Ursula K. LeGuin

data.quote: The beginning of compunction is the beginning of a new life.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: The Pilgrims didn't have any experience when they landed here. Hell  if experience was that important  we'd never have anybody walking on the moon.
data.author: Doug Rader

data.quote: Each person has a literature inside them. But when people lose language  when they have to experiment with putting their thoughts together on the spot-that's what I love most. That's where character lives.
data.author: Anna Deavere Smith

data.quote: There is no data on the future.
data.author: Laurel Cutler

data.quote: The most important fact about Spaceship Earth: an instruction book didn't come with it.
data.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

data.quote: Life is the only art that we are required to practice without preparation  and without being allowed the preliminary trials  the failures and botches  that are essential for the training of a mere beginner.
data.author: Lewis Mumford

data.quote: Time has told me less than I need to know.
data.author: Gwen Harwood

data.quote: I learn by going where I have to go.
data.author: Theodore Roethke

data.quote: Life is like playing a violin in public and learning the instrument as one goes on.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: We don't have enough time to premeditate all our actions.
data.author: Vauvenargues

data.quote: Every year  if not every day  we have to wager our salvation upon some prophecy based upon imperfect knowledge.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Faith ... acts promptly and boldly on the occasion  on slender evidence.
data.author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

data.quote: A decision is an action you must take when you have information so incomplete that the answer does not suggest itself.
data.author: Arthur Radford

data.quote: She knew in her heart that to be without optimism  that core of reasonless hope in the spirit  rather than the brain  was a fatal flaw  the seed of death.
data.author: Anne Perry

data.quote: When faith is supported by facts or by logic it ceases to be faith.
data.author: Edith Hamilton

data.quote: How far would Moses have gone if he had taken a poll in Egypt?
data.author: Harry S. Truman

data.quote: Better to be without logic than without feeling.
data.author: Charlotte Bronte

data.quote: The will to be totally rational is the will to be made out of glass and steel: and to use others as if they were glass and steel.
data.author: Marge Piercy

data.quote: In the three years I played ball  we won six  lost seventeen and tied two. Some statistician ... calculated that we won 75 percent of the games we didn't lose.
data.author: Roger M. Blough

data.quote: Imagination took the reins  and Reason  slow-paced  though surefooted  was unequal to a race with so eccentric and flighty a companion.
data.author: Fanny Burney

data.quote: Many persons of high intelligence have notoriously poor judgement.
data.author: Sydney J. Harris

data.quote: How dangerous can false reasoning prove!
data.author: Sophocles

data.quote: The tendency of modern science is to reduce proof to absurdity by continually reducing absurdity to proof.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: Say you were standing with one foot in the oven and one foot in an ice bucket. According to the percentage people  you would be perfectly comfortable.
data.author: Bobby Bragan

data.quote: Logic is the art of going wrong with confidence.
data.author: Joseph Wood Krutch

data.quote: Reason  with most people  means their own opinions.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Logic pervades the world  the limits of the world are also the limits of logic.
data.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

data.quote: Man is a reasoning  rather than a reasonable  animal.
data.author: Alexander Hamilton

data.quote: False conclusions which have been reasoned out are infinitely worse than blind impulse.
data.author: Horace Mann

data.quote: If you do everything you should do  and do not do anything you should not do  you will  according to the best available statistics  live exactly eighteen hours longer than you would otherwise.
data.author: Dr. Logain Clendening

data.quote: Decisions  particularly important ones  have always made me sleepy  perhaps because I know that I will have to make them by instinct  and thinking things out is only what other people tell me I should do.
data.author: Lillian Hellman

data.quote: Statistics are no substitute for judgement.
data.author: Henry Clay

data.quote: It is the heart always that sees before the head can see.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Facts are stubborn things  but statistics are more pliable.
data.author: Laurence J. Peter

data.quote: A true history of human events would show that a far larger proportion of our acts are the result of sudden impulse and accident than of that reason of which we so much boast.
data.author: Peter Cooper

data.quote: It is always thus  impaled by a state of mind which is destined not to last  that we make our irrevocable decisions.
data.author: Marcel Proust

data.quote: A power greater than any human being helped make this decision.
data.author: Herbert J. Steifel

data.quote: He who reflects too much will achieve little.
data.author: J. C. F. von Schiller

data.quote: The opportunity is often lost by deliberating.
data.author: Publilius Syrus

data.quote: The percentage of mistakes in quick decisions is no greater than in long-drawn-out vacillations  and the effect of decisiveness itself "makes things go" and creates confidence.
data.author: Anne O'Hare McCormick

data.quote: Deliberation often loses a good chance.
data.author: Latin proverb

data.quote: The mania of thinking renders one unfit for every activity.
data.author: Anatole France

data.quote: When possible make the decisions now  even if action is in the future. A revised decision usually is better than one reached at the last moment.
data.author: William B. Given

data.quote: We spend our days in deliberating  and we end them without coming to any resolve.
data.author: L'Estrange

data.quote: If you think too long  you think wrong.
data.author: Jim Kaat

data.quote: You decide you'll wait for your pitch. Then as the ball starts toward the plate  you think about your stance. And then you think about your swing. And then you realize that the ball that went past you for a strike was your pitch.
data.author: Bobby Murcer

data.quote: The soul of dispatch is decision.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: The moment a question comes to your mind  see yourself mentally taking hold of it and disposing of it. In that moment... you learn to become the decider and not the vacillator. Thus you build character.
data.author: H. Van Anderson

data.quote: So what do we do? Anything. Something. So long as we just don't sit there. If we screw it up  start over. Try something else. If we wait until we've satisfied all the uncertainties  it may be too late.
data.author: Lee Iacocca

data.quote: Often greater risk is involved in postponement than in making a wrong decision.
data.author: Harry A. Hopf

data.quote: Some persons are very decisive when it comes to avoiding decisions.
data.author: Brendan Francis

data.quote: Do not wait for ideal circumstances  nor the best opportunities  they will never come.
data.author: Janet Erskine Stuart

data.quote: There comes a time when you've got to say  "Let's get off our asses and go ..." I have always found that if I move with 75 percent or more of the facts I usually never regret it. It's the guys who wait to have everything perfect that drive you crazy.
data.author: Lee Iacocca

data.quote: Conditions are never just right. People who delay action until all factors are favorable do nothing.
data.author: William Feather

data.quote: Common sense does not ask an impossible chessboard  but takes the one before it and plays the game.
data.author: Wendell Phillips

data.quote: He who postpones the hour of living is like the rustic who waits for the river to run out before he crosses.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: If you wait for inspiration you'll be standing on the corner after the parade is a mile down the street.
data.author: Ben Nicholas

data.quote: Nothing at all will be attempted if all possible objections must first be overcome.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: It is the characteristic excellence of the strong man that he can bring momentous issues to the fore and make a decision about them. The weak are always forced to decide between alternatives they have not chosen themselves.
data.author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

data.quote: Alternatives  and particularly desirable alternatives  grow only on imaginary trees.
data.author: Saul Bellow

data.quote: The more one does and sees and feels  the more one is able to do  and the more genuine may be one's own appreciation of fundamental things like home  and love  and understanding companionship.
data.author: Amelia Earhart

data.quote: Our danger is not too few  but too many options ... to be puzzled by innumerable alternatives.
data.author: Sir Richard Livingstone

data.quote: The absence of alternatives clears the mind marvelously.
data.author: Henry Kissinger

data.quote: I couldn't claim that I have never felt the urge to explore evil  but when you descend into hell you have to be very careful.
data.author: Kathleen Raine

data.quote: If decisions were a choice between alternatives  decisions would come easy. Decision is the selection and formulation of alternatives.
data.author: Kenneth Burke

data.quote: You cannot have your cake and eat it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: It is better to arm and strengthen your hero  than to disarm and enfeeble your foe.
data.author: Anne Bronte

data.quote: You cannot sell the cow and sup the milk.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: There is only one answer to destruc-tiveness and that is creativity.
data.author: Sylvia Ashton-Warner

data.quote: A door must either be shut or open.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Here's a rule I recommend. Never practice two vices at once.
data.author: Tallulah Bankhead

data.quote: You cannot serve God and Mammon.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Between two stools one sits on the ground.
data.author: French proverb

data.quote: When you cannot make up your mind between two evenly balanced courses of action  choose the bolder.
data.author: W. J. Slim

data.quote: When confronted with two courses of action I jot down on a piece of paper all the arguments in favor of each one  then on the opposite side I write the arguments against each one. Then by weighing the arguments pro and con and cancelling them out  one against the other  I take the course indicated by what remains.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.
data.author: Edith Wharton

data.quote: You cannot have it both ways.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I would sort out all the arguments and see which belonged to fear and which to creativeness. Other things being equal  I would make the decision which had the larger number of creative reasons on its side.
data.author: Katharine Butler Hathaway

data.quote: Of two evils  choose the less.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Of two evils  choose the prettier.
data.author: Carolyn Wells

data.quote: Where bad's the best  bad must be the choice.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Both choices are painful  but only one is therapeutic.
data.author: Albert M. Wells

data.quote: God offers to every mind its choice between truth and repose. Take which you please-you can never have both.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Necessity relieves us from the embarrassment of choice.
data.author: Vauvenargues

data.quote: When you have to make a choice and don't make it  that is in itself a choice.
data.author: William James

data.quote: A man without decision can never be said to belong to himself  he is as a wave of the sea  or a feather in the air which every breeze blows about.
data.author: John Foster

data.quote: Nothing is so exhausting as indecision  and nothing is so futile.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: Not to decide is to decide.
data.author: Harvey Cox

data.quote: Decision is a sharp knife that cuts clean and straight  indecision  a dull one that hacks and tears and leaves ragged edges behind it.
data.author: Gordon Graham

data.quote: There is no more miserable human being than one in whom nothing is habitual but indecision.
data.author: William James

data.quote: In not making the decision  you've made one. Not doing something is the same as doing it.
data.author: Ivan Bloch

data.quote: There is a time when we must firmly choose the course we will follow  or the relentless drift of events will make the decision for us.
data.author: Herbert B. Prochnow

data.quote: You can only predict things after they've happened.
data.author: Eugene Ionesco

data.quote: It is the mark of a good action that it appears inevitable  in retrospect.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: No one knows what he can to do until he tries.
data.author: Publilius Syrus

data.quote: Of all paths a man could strike into  there is  at any given moment  a best path which  here and now  it were of all things wisest for him to do. To find this path  and walk in it  is the one thing needful for him.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Decisions  particularly important ones  have always made me sleepy  perhaps because I know that I will have to make them by instinct  and thinking things out is only what other people tell me I should do.
data.author: Lillian Hellman

data.quote: After a battle is over people talk a lot about how decisions were methodically reached  but actually there's always a hell of a lot of groping around.
data.author: Admiral Frank Jack Fletcher

data.quote: No question is ever settled until it is settled right.
data.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

data.quote: No man who has not sat in the assemblies of men can know the light  odd and uncertain ways in which decisions are often arrived at.
data.author: Sir Arthur Helps

data.quote: No trumpets sound when the important decisions of our life are made. Destiny is made known silently.
data.author: Agnes de Mille

data.quote: A man must be able to cut a knot  for everything cannot be untied.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: Once to every man and nation comes the moment to decide ... And the choice goes by forever t'wixt that darkness and that light.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: Necessity is not an established fact  but an interpretation.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: We are not permitted to choose the frame of our destiny. But what we put into it is ours.
data.author: Dag Hammarskjold

data.quote: There is a point at which everything becomes simple and there is no longer any question of choice  because all you have staked will be lost if you look back. Life's point of no return.
data.author: Dag Hammarskjold

data.quote: Optimism is an intellectual choice.
data.author: Diana Schneider

data.quote: The lame man who keeps the right road outstrips the runner who takes a wrong one ... the more active and swift the latter is  the further he will go astray.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: Nothing is more difficult  and therefore more precious  than to be able to decide.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: There is one quality more important than know-how.... This is know-how by which we determine not only how to accomplish our purposes  but what our purposes are to be.
data.author: Norbert Weiner

data.quote: Destiny is not a matter of chance  it is a matter of choice  it is not a thing to be waited for  it is a thing to be achieved.
data.author: William Jennings Bryan

data.quote: What must be  shall be  and that which is a necessity to him that struggles is little more than choice to him that is willing.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: A wiser rule would be to make up your mind soberly what you want  peace or war  and then to get ready for what you want  for what we prepare for is what we shall get.
data.author: William Graham Sumner

data.quote: We have resolved to endure the unendurable and suffer what is insufferable.
data.author: Emperor Hirohito

data.quote: Once a decision was made  I did not worry about it afterward.
data.author: Harry S. Truman

data.quote: No country can act wisely simultaneously in every part of the globe at every moment of time.
data.author: Henry Kissinger

data.quote: The last  if not the greatest  of the human freedoms: to choose their own attitude in any given circumstance.
data.author: Bruno Bettelheim

data.quote: He who has a choice has trouble.
data.author: Dutch proverb

data.quote: We have left undone those things which we ought to have done  and we have done those things which we ought not to have done.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Little deeds of kindness  little words of love  Make our earth an Eden like the heaven above.
data.author: Julia F. Carney

data.quote: Whatever is worth doing at all is worth doing well.
data.author: Lord Chesterfield

data.quote: Give me the ready hand rather than the ready tongue.
data.author: Giuseppe Garibaldi

data.quote: Noble deeds that are concealed are most esteemed.
data.author: Pascal

data.quote: Heaven ne'er helps the man who will not help himself.
data.author: Sophocles

data.quote: Do not be afraid of defeat. You are never so near to victory as when defeated in a good cause.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: To lose Is to learn.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: We have fought this fight as long  and as well as we know how. We have been defeated. For us  as a Christian people  there is now but one course to pursue. We must accept the situation.
data.author: Robert E. Lee

data.quote: I let the American people down  and I have to carry that burden for the rest of my life. My political life is over. I will never again have an opportunity to serve in any official position. Maybe I can give a little advice from time to time.
data.author: Richard Nixon

data.quote: What is defeat? Nothing but education  nothing but the first step toward something better.
data.author: Wendell Phillips

data.quote: Who  apart From ourselves  can see any difference between Our victories and our defeats?
data.author: Christopher Fry

data.quote: They were never defeated  they were only killed.
data.author: French Foreign Legion

data.quote: The mountain remains unmoved at seeming defeat by the mist.
data.author: Rabindranath Tagore

data.quote: It is defeat that turns bone to flint  it is defeat that turns gristle to muscle  it is defeat that makes men invincible.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: What is defeat? Nothing but education  nothing but the first step to something better.
data.author: Wendell Phillips

data.quote: Defeat should never be a source of discouragement but rather a fresh stimulus.
data.author: Robert South

data.quote: Demagogues and agitators are very unpleasant  but they are incidents to a free and constitutional country  and you must put up with these inconveniences or do without many important advantages.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: In every age the vilest specimens of human nature are to be found among demagogues.
data.author: Macaulay

data.quote: Every one that was in distress  and every one that was in debt  and every one that was discontented  gathered themselves unto him  and he became a captain over them.
data.author: I Samuel

data.quote: A wise fellow who is also worthless always charms the rabble.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: Democracy is based upon the conviction that there are extraordinary possibilities in ordinary people.
data.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

data.quote: In a democracy  the opposition is not only tolerated as constitutional  but must be maintained because it is indispensable.
data.author: Walter Lippmann

data.quote: It has been said that Democracy is the worst form of government except all those other forms that have been tried from time to time.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Democracy is based on the conviction that man has the moral and intellectual capacity  as well as the inalienable right  to govern himself with reason and justice.
data.author: Harry S. Truman

data.quote: If you want to understand democracy  spend less time in the library with Plato  and more time in the buses with people.
data.author: Simeon Strunsky

data.quote: Democracy is a small hard core of common agreement  surrounded by a rich variety of individual differences.
data.author: James Bryant Conant

data.quote: People often say that  in a democracy  decisions are made by a majority of the people. Of course  that is not true. Decisions are made by a majority of those who make themselves heard and who vote - a very different thing.
data.author: Walter H. Judd

data.quote: Democracy means government by the uneducated  while aristocracy means government by the badly educated.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: My definition of a free society is a society where it is safe to be unpopular.
data.author: Adlai Stevenson

data.quote: It is the greatest good to the greatest number which is the measure of right and wrong.
data.author: Jeremy Bent ham

data.quote: The greatest blessing of our democracy is freedom. But in the last analysis  our only freedom is the freedom to discipline ourselves.
data.author: Bernard Baruch

data.quote: Democracy is the recurrent suspicion that more than half of the people are right more than half of the time.
data.author: E. B. White

data.quote: The worst form of inequality is to try to make unequal things equal.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: What men value in the world is not rights  but privileges.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: As I would not be a slave  so I would not be a master. This expresses my idea of democracy.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Democracy is a festival of mediocrity.
data.author: E. M. Cioran

data.quote: The job of a citizen is to keep his mouth open.
data.author: Gunter Grass

data.quote: It would be folly to argue that the people cannot make political mistakes. They can and do make grave mistakes. They know it  they pay the penalty  but compared with the mistakes which have been made by every kind of autocracy they are unimportant.
data.author: Calvin Coolidge

data.quote: Democracy is based upon the conviction that there are extraordinary possibilities in ordinary people.
data.author: Harry Emerson

data.quote: The world must be made safe for democracy.
data.author: Woodrow Wilson

data.quote: Democracy is the government of the people  by the people  for the people.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Democracy means not "I am as good as you are " but "You are as good as I am."
data.author: Theodore Parker

data.quote: All the ills of democracy can be cured by more democracy.
data.author: Alfred E. Smith

data.quote: I believe in Democracy because it releases the energies of every human being.
data.author: Woodrow Wilson

data.quote: While democracy must have its organization and controls  its vital breath is individual liberty.
data.author: Charles Evans Hughes

data.quote: People may live as much retired from the world as they please  but sooner or later  before they are aware  they will find themselves debtor or creditor to somebody.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: He who imagines he can do without the world deceives himself much  but he who fancies the world cannot do without him is still more mistaken.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: It is easier to suppress the first desire than to satisfy all that follow it.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: There are two tragedies in life. One is not to get your heart's desire. The other is to get it.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Our desires always increase with our possessions. The knowledge that something remains yet unenjoyed impairs our enjoyment of the good before us.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: He who desires naught will always be free.
data.author: E. R. Lefebvre Laboulaye

data.quote: Ah love! could you and I with Him conspire To grasp this sorry scheme of things entire  Would not we shatter it to bits - and then Re-mold it nearer to the heart's desire!
data.author: Omar Khayyam

data.quote: Ail hope abandon  ye who enter here.
data.author: Dante Alighieri

data.quote: Despair is the conclusion of fools.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: Despair doubles our strength.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: It is the old practice of despots to use a part of the people to keep the rest in order.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: Despotism can no more exist in a nation until the liberty of the press be destroyed than the night can happen before the sun is set.
data.author: Walter Colton

data.quote: I will believe in the right of one man to govern a nation despotically when I find a man born unto the world with boots and spurs  and a nation with saddles on their backs.
data.author: Algernon Sidney

data.quote: We are but as the instrument of Heaven. Our work is not design  but destiny.
data.author: Owen Meredith

data.quote: Every man meets his Waterloo at last.
data.author: Wendell Phillips

data.quote: There is a divinity that shapes our ends  Rough-hew them how we will.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Here is the devil-and-all to pay.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: Resist the Devil  and he will flee from you.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: The devil was sick  the devil a monk would be  The devil was well  the devil a monk was he.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: How art thou fallen from heaven  O Lucifer  son of the morning!
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Get thee behind me  Satan.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: He will give the devil his due.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The prince of darkness is a gentleman.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The devil can cite Scripture for his purpose.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Everyone gets their rough day. No one gets a free ride. Today so far  I had a good day. I got a dial tone.
data.author: Rodney Dangerfield

data.quote: Thy fate is the common fate of all  Into each life some rain must fall  Some days must be dark and dreary.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Some days you tame the tiger. And some days the tiger has you for lunch.
data.author: Tug McGraw

data.quote: Some days the dragon wins.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The one law that does not change is that everything changes  and the hardship I was bearing today was only a breath away from the pleasures I would have tomorrow  and those pleasures would be all the richer because of the memories of this I was enduring.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: Experience cold or heat  pleasure or pain. These experiences are fleeting  they come and go. Bear them patiently.
data.author: Sri Krishna

data.quote: To everything there is a season  A time for every purpose under heaven.... A time to weep  and a time to laugh  A time to mourn  and a time to dance.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Let nothing disturb thee  Let nothing affright thee  All things are passing  God changeth never.
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: This  too  shall pass.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The present will not long endure.
data.author: Pindar

data.quote: We do not live an equal life  but one of contrasts and patchwork  now a little joy  then a sorrow  now a sin  then a generous or brave action.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I feel successful when the writing goes well. This lasts five minutes. Once  when I was number one on the bestseller list  I also felt successful. That lasted three minutes.
data.author: Jacqueline Briskin

data.quote: Sadness and gladness succeed each other.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: I don't think that ... one gets a flash of happiness once  and never again  it is there within you  and it will come as certainly as death....
data.author: Isak Dinesen

data.quote: Life comes in clusters  clusters of solitude  then clusters when there is hardly time to breathe.
data.author: May Sarton

data.quote: If winter comes  can spring be far behind?
data.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

data.quote: Human misery must somewhere have a stop  there is no wind that always blows a storm.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: No winter lasts forever  no spring skips its turn.
data.author: Hal Borland

data.quote: There are trees that seem to die at the end of autumn. There are also the evergreens.
data.author: Gilbert Maxwell

data.quote: Our Lord has written the promise of resurrection  not in books alone  but in every leaf in springtime.
data.author: Martin Luther

data.quote: For  lo  the winter is past  the rain is over and gone  the flowers appear on the earth.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: If matters go badly now  they will not always be so.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: Pain is never permanent.
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: You will suffer and you will hurt. You will have joy and you will have peace.
data.author: Alison Cheek

data.quote: Pain is part of being alive  and we need to learn that. Pain does not last forever  nor is it necessarily unbearable  and we need to be taught that.
data.author: Rabbi Harold Kushner

data.quote: Pain is hard to bear.... But with patience  day by day  Even this shall pass away.
data.author: Theodore Tilton

data.quote: Everything in life that we really accept undergoes a change. So suffering must become love. That is the mystery.
data.author: Katherine Mansfield

data.quote: I've been failing for  like  ten or eleven years. When it turns  it'll turn. Right now I'm just tryin' to squeeze through a very tight financial period  get the movie out  and put my things in order.
data.author: Francis Ford Coppola

data.quote: I've never been poor  only broke. Being poor is a frame of mind. Being broke is a temporary situation.
data.author: Mike Todd

data.quote: In the darkest hour the soul is replenished and given strength to continue and endure.
data.author: Heart Warrior Chosa

data.quote: He that can't endure the bad will not live to see the good.
data.author: Yiddish proverb

data.quote: Our toil is sweet with thankfulness  Our burden is our boon  The curse of earth's gray morning is The blessing of its noon.
data.author: John Greenleaf Whittier

data.quote: Were it possible for us to see further than our knowledge reaches  perhaps we would endure our sadnesses with greater confidence than our joys. For they are moments when something new has entered into us  something unknown.
data.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

data.quote: We may draw good outof evil  we must not do evil  that good may come.
data.author: Maria Weston Chapman

data.quote: You will find a joy in overcoming obstacles.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: What we call the beginning is often an end. And to make an end is to make a beginning. The end is where we start from.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: When one door of happiness closes  another opens  but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: Death is a door life opens.
data.author: Adela Rogers St. John

data.quote: The world is round  and the place which may seem like the end may also be only the beginning.
data.author: Ivy Baker Priest

data.quote: Perhaps someday it will be pleasant to remember even this.
data.author: Virgil

data.quote: One day in retrospect the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful.
data.author: Sigmund Freud

data.quote: The crisis of today is the joke of tomorrow.
data.author: H. G. Wells

data.quote: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: Sometimes I found that in my happy moments I could not believe that I had ever been miserable.
data.author: Joanna Field

data.quote: If our education had included training to bear unpleasantness and to let the first shock pass until we could think more calmly  many an unbearable situation would become manageable  and many a nervous illness avoided. There is a proverb expressing this. It says  trouble is a tunnel through which we pass and not a brick wall against which we must break our head.
data.author: Claire Weeks

data.quote: Time  in the turning-over of days  works change  for better or worse.
data.author: Pindar

data.quote: Experience is what really happens to you in the long run  the truth that finally overtakes you.
data.author: Katherine Anne Porter

data.quote: Time is like a river of fleeting events  and its current is strong  as soon as something comes into sight  it is swept past us  and something else takes its place  and that too will be swept away.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Time cools  time clarifies  no mood can be maintained quite unaltered through the course of hours.
data.author: Thomas Mann

data.quote: Time bears away all things.
data.author: Virgil

data.quote: Come what come may  time and the hour runs through the roughest day.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Time brings all things to pass.
data.author: Aeschylus

data.quote: We undo ourselves by impatience. Misfortunes have their life and their limits  their sickness and their health.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: The future is something which everyone reaches at the rate of sixty minutes an hour  whatever he does  whoever he is.
data.author: C. S. Lewis

data.quote: That's the advantage of having lived sixty-five years. You don't feel the need to be impatient any longer.
data.author: Thornton Wilder

data.quote: Who longest waits most surely wins.
data.author: Helen Hunt Jackson

data.quote: Patience is a bitter plant  but it has sweet fruit.
data.author: German proverb

data.quote: No emergency excuses you from exercising tolerance.
data.author: Phyllis Bottome

data.quote: I believe the sign of maturity is accepting deferred gratification.
data.author: Peggy Cahn

data.quote: He that can have patience can have what he will.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Being human  we should bear all we can.
data.author: Norma Meacock

data.quote: Adopt the pace of nature  her secret is patience.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: You can't have genius without patience.
data.author: Margaret Deland

data.quote: The most potent and sacred command which can be laid upon any artist is the command: wait.
data.author: Iris Murdoch

data.quote: How poor are they that have not patience? What wound did ever heal but by degrees?
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: All things come round to him who will but wait.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Panic is not an effective long-term organizing strategy.
data.author: Starhawk

data.quote: Self-denial is painful for a moment  but very agreeable in the end.
data.author: Jane Taylor

data.quote: And he shall reign a goodly king And sway his hand o'er every clime With peace writ on his signet ring  Who bides his time.
data.author: James Whitcomb Riley

data.quote: It takes time to succeed because success is merely the natural reward of taking time to do anything well.
data.author: Joseph Ross

data.quote: Patience and fortitude conquer all things.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Be not afraid of growing slowly  be afraid only of standing still.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: Wisely and slow. They stumble that run fast.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: No great thing is created suddenly  any more than a bunch of grapes or a fig. If you tell me that you desire a fig  I answer you that there must be time. Let it first blossom  then bear fruit  then ripen.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: Time deals gently only with those who take it gently.
data.author: Anatole France

data.quote: Hold on  hold fast  hold out. Patience is genius.
data.author: Georges de Buffon

data.quote: Genius is nothing but a greater aptitude for patience.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: All human wisdom is summed up in two words: wait and hope.
data.author: Alexandre Dumas

data.quote: Genius is eternal patience.
data.author: Michelangelo

data.quote: Serene I fold my hands and wait.
data.author: John Burroughs

data.quote: The race is not to the swift  nor the battle to the strong.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Everything comes if a man will only wait.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: Everything comes to him who hustles while he waits.
data.author: Thomas A. Edison

data.quote: The secret of patience ... to do something else in the meantime.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Have patience with all things  but chiefly have patience with yourself. Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections  but instantly set about remedying them-every day begin the task anew.
data.author: Saint Francis de Sales

data.quote: Let us then be up and doing  With a heart for any fate  Still achieving  still pursuing  Learn to labor and to wait.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: God will wait as long as it takes for us.
data.author: Reverend R. Walters

data.quote: Waiting is not mere empty hoping. It has the inner certainty of reaching the goal.
data.author: I Ching

data.quote: All things come to him who waits- provided he knows what he is waiting for.
data.author: Woodrow Wilson

data.quote: Hope and patience are two sovereign remedies for all  the surest reposals  the softest cushions to lean on in adversity.
data.author: Robert Burton

data.quote: The strongest of all warriors are these two-Time and Patience.
data.author: Leo Tolstoy

data.quote: Who bides his time tastes the sweet Of honey in the saltiest tear  And though he fares with slowest feet Joy runs to meet him drawing near.
data.author: James Whitcomb Riley

data.quote: God grant us patience!
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Better is the end of a thing than the beginning thereof: and the patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: There is nothing so bitter that a patient mind cannot find some solace for it.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Patience is the best remedy for every trouble.
data.author: Plautus

data.quote: For ye have need of patience....
data.author: Bible

data.quote: They are ill discoverers that think there is no land  when they see nothing but sea.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: The best way out of a difficulty is through it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Many things difficult to design prove easy to performance.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: A diplomat is a man who remembers a lady's birthday but forgets her age.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: When a diplomat says yes he means perhaps  when he says perhaps he means no  when he says no he is no diplomat.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I have discovered the art of deceiving diplomats. I speak the truth  and they never believe me.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Diplomacy is to do and say The nastiest thing in the nicest way.
data.author: Isaac Goldberg

data.quote: Disappointment is the nurse of wisdom.
data.author: Sir Boyle Roche

data.quote: The best-laid schemes o' mice an' men  Gang aft a-gley  And leave us nought but grief and pain  For promised joy.
data.author: James Drummond Burns

data.quote: Disappointments are to the soul what a thunder-storm is to the air.
data.author: Friedrich von Schiller

data.quote: Men would be angels  Angels would be gods.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: Now is the Winter of our discontent.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: I was born to other things.
data.author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

data.quote: Discontent is the first step in the progress of a man or a nation.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: Discretion in speech is more than eloquence.
data.author: Sir Francis Bacon

data.quote: A sound discretion is not so much indicated by never making a mistake as by never repeating it.
data.author: Christian Nestell Bovee

data.quote: Great ability without discretion comes almost invariably to a tragic end.
data.author: Leon Gambetta

data.quote: Let your own discretion be your tutor  suit the action to the word  the word to the action.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The better part of valour is discretion.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Disease is the retribution of outraged Nature.
data.author: Hosea Ballou

data.quote: Disease is an experience of so-called mortal mind. It is fear made manifest on the body.
data.author: Mary Baker Eddy

data.quote: Desperate diseases require desperate remedies.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: Some remedies are worse than the disease.
data.author: Syrus

data.quote: Whatever disgrace we may have deserved  it is almost always in our power to re-establish our character.
data.author: Plautus

data.quote: No one can disgrace us but ourselves.
data.author: J. G. Holland

data.quote: Doubt the man who swears to his devotion.
data.author: Mme. Louise Colet

data.quote: Women distrust men too much in general  and too little in particular.
data.author: Philibert Commerson

data.quote: What loneliness is more lonely than distrust?
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: Doctrine is nothing but the skin of truth set up and stuffed.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: How absurd to try to make two men think alike on matters of religion  when I cannot make two timepieces agree!
data.author: Charles V

data.quote: In religion as in politics it so happens that we have less charity for those who believe half our creed  than for diose who deny the whole of it.
data.author: Walter Colton

data.quote: You can and you can't  You will and you won't  You'll be damn'd if you do  You'll be damn'd if you don't.
data.author: Lorenzo Dow

data.quote: "Orthodoxy  my Lord " said Bishop Warburton  in a whisper   -  "orthodoxy is my doxy   -  heterodoxy is another man's doxy."
data.author: Joseph Priestley

data.quote: Do not disturb the sleeping dog.
data.author: Alessandro Allegri

data.quote: Every dog is entitled to one bite.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Who loves me will love my dog also.
data.author: St. Bernard of Clairvaux

data.quote: You're only a dog  old fellow  a dog  and you've had your day  But never a friend of all my friends has been truer than you alway.
data.author: Julian S. Cutler

data.quote: I agree with Agassiz that dogs possess something very like a conscience.
data.author: Charles Darwin

data.quote: Oh  the saddest of sights in a world of sin Is a little lost pup with his tail tucked in!
data.author: Arthur Guiterman

data.quote: Fox-terriers are born with about four times as much original sin in them as other dogs.
data.author: Jerome K. Jerome

data.quote: The more one comes to know men  the more one comes to admire the dog.
data.author: Joussenel

data.quote: The dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters' table.
data.author: Matthew

data.quote: The cowardly dog barks more violently than it bites.
data.author: Quintus Curtius Rufus

data.quote: Every dog must have his day.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: Gentlemen of die Jury: The one  absolute  unselfish friend that man can have in this selfish world  the one that never deserts him  the one that never proves ungrateful or treacherous  is his dog.
data.author: Senator George Graham Vest

data.quote: Galileo called doubt the father of invention  it is certainly the pioneer.
data.author: Christian Nestell Bovee

data.quote: Of that there is no manner of doubt -  No probable  possible shadow of doubt -  No possible doubt whatever.
data.author: W. S. Gilbert

data.quote: We know accurately only when we know little  with knowledge doubt increases.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: When in doubt  win the trick.
data.author: Edmund Hoyle

data.quote: I respect faith  but doubt is what gets you an education.
data.author: Wilson Mizner

data.quote: And he that doubteth is damned if he eat.
data.author: Romans

data.quote: To be  or not to be  that is the question: Whether 'tis nobler in the mind to suffer The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune  Or to take arms against a sea of troubles  And by opposing end them?
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Our doubts are traitors And make us lose the good we oft might win By fearing to attempt.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: There lives more faith in honest doubt  Believe me  than in half the creeds
data.author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

data.quote: I'm from Missouri  you must show me.
data.author: Colonel Willard D. Vandiver

data.quote: Unrest and uncertainty are our lot.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: Life is uncertain. Eat dessert first.
data.author: Ernestine Ulmer

data.quote: If we insist on being as sure as is conceivable ... we must be content to creep along the ground  and can never soar.
data.author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

data.quote: Nothing  perhaps  is strange  once you have accepted life itself  the great strange business which includes all lesser strangeness.
data.author: Rose Macaulay

data.quote: The shortest period of time lies between the minute you put some money away for a rainy day and the unexpected arrival of rain.
data.author: Jane Bryant Quinn

data.quote: Our lives are never certain  even for an hour.
data.author: Ferrant Sanchez Calavera

data.quote: Throughout this life  you can never be certain of living long enough to take another breath.
data.author: Huang Po

data.quote: I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned  the hard way  that some poems don't rhyme  and some stories don't have a clear beginning  middle  and end. Life is about not knowing  having to change  taking the moment and making the best of it without knowing what's going to happen next.
data.author: Gilda Radner

data.quote: Where will I be five years from now? I delight in not knowing.
data.author: Mario Thomas

data.quote: The longing for certainty ... is in every human mind. But certainty is generally illusion.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: No great deed is done by falterers who ask for certainty.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: Every year  if not every day  we have to wager our salvation upon some prophecy based upon imperfect knowledge.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: We are not certain  we are never certain.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: We live in an epoch in which the solid ground of our preconceived ideas shakes daily under our certain feet.
data.author: Barbara Ward

data.quote: All business proceeds on beliefs  or judgment of probabilities  and not on certainties.
data.author: Charles W. Eliot

data.quote: The man who insists upon seeing with perfect clearness before he decides  never decides.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: There is nothing certain in a man's life but that he must lose it.
data.author: Owen Meredith

data.quote: Ah  what a dusty answer gets the soul when hot for certainties in this  our life!
data.author: George Meredith

data.quote: When I was young I was sure of everything  in a few years  having been mistaken a thousand times  I was not half so sure of most things as I was before  at present  I am hardly sure of anything but what God has revealed.
data.author: John Wesley

data.quote: We can be absolutely certain only about things we do not understand.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: You are all you will ever have for certain.
data.author: June Havoc

data.quote: Certitude is not the test of certainty. We have been cock-sure of many things that were not so.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: A reasonable probability is the only certainty.
data.author: Edgar Watson Howe

data.quote: Doubt is not a pleasant state  but certainty is a ridiculous one.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: Being unready and ill-equipped is what you have to expect in life. It is the universal predicament. It is your lot as a human being to lack what it takes. Circumstances are seldom right. You never have the capacities  the strength  the wisdom  the virtue you ought to have. You must always do with less than you need in a situation vastly different from what you would have chosen.
data.author: Charlton Ogburn

data.quote: To be absolutely certain about something  one must know everything  or nothing  about it.
data.author: Olin Miller

data.quote: Free man is by necessity insecure  thinking man by necessity uncertain.
data.author: Erich Fromm

data.quote: We sail within a vast sphere  ever drifting in uncertainty  driven from end to end.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: Something must be left to chance  nothing is sure in a sea fight.
data.author: Horatio Nelson

data.quote: There is nothing certain about war except that one side won't win.
data.author: Sir Ian Hamilton

data.quote: There is only one thing about which I am certain  and this is that there is very little about which one can be certain.
data.author: W Somerset Maugham

data.quote: The only certainty is that nothing is certain.
data.author: Pliny the Elder

data.quote: I'm often wrong  but never in doubt.
data.author: Ivy Baker Priest

data.quote: There is one thing certain  namely  that we can have nothing certain  therefore it is not certain that we can have nothing certain.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: Every area of trouble gives out a ray of hope  and the one unchangeable certainty is that nothing is certain or unchangeable.
data.author: John E. Kennedy

data.quote: Any coward can fight a battle when he's sure of winning.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: The demand is for certainty is a sign of weakness.
data.author: Mark Rutherford

data.quote: The unknown is what it is. And to be frightened of it is what sends everybody scurrying around chasing dreams  illusions  wars  peace  love  hate  all that.... Accept that it's unknown  and it's plain sailing.
data.author: John Lennon

data.quote: Only a weak mind seeks ultimate answers.
data.author: Agnes Thornton

data.quote: When nothing is sure  everything is possible.
data.author: Margaret Drabble

data.quote: He who forecasts all perils will never sail the sea.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: There is a time for departure  even when there's no certain place to go.
data.author: Tennessee Williams

data.quote: One doesn't discover new lands without consenting to lose sight of shore for a very long time.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: To teach how to live with uncertainty  yet without being paralyzed by hesitation  is perhaps the chief thing that philosophy can do.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: Faith ... acts promptly and boldly on the occasion  on slender evidence.
data.author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

data.quote: If we wait until we've satisfied all the uncertainties  it may be too late.
data.author: Lee Iacocca

data.quote: The successful man is he who  when he sees that no further certainty is attainable  promptly decides on the most probable side  as if he were completely sure it was right.
data.author: Mark Rutherford

data.quote: Not seeing is half-believing.
data.author: Vita Sackville-West

data.quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched-they must be felt with the heart.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: There is no advancement to him who stands trembling because he cannot see the end from the beginning.
data.author: E. J. Klemme

data.quote: I am a woman who understands the necessity of an impulse whose goal or origin still lie beyond me.
data.author: Olga Broumas

data.quote: To end with certainty  we must begin with doubting.
data.author: Stanislaus

data.quote: Gardening is an exercise in optimism.
data.author: Maria Schinz

data.quote: In the face of uncertainty  there is nothing wrong with hope.
data.author: Bernie S. Siegel

data.quote: No object is mysterious. The mystery is your eye.
data.author: Elizabeth Bowen

data.quote: Faith hasn't got no eyes  but she's long-legged.
data.author: Zora Neale Hurston

data.quote: Maturity of mind is the capacity to endure uncertainty.
data.author: John H. Finley

data.quote: Don't be afraid of the space between your dreams and reality. If you can dream it  you can make it so.
data.author: Belva Davis

data.quote: If a man will begin with certainties  he shall end in doubts  but if he will content to begin with doubts  he shall end in certainties.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: I said here's the river I want to flow on  here's the direction I want to go  and put my boat in. I was ready for the river to take unexpected turns and present obstacles.
data.author: Nancy Woodhull

data.quote: The future is no more uncertain than the present.
data.author: Walt Whitman

data.quote: Nobody can really guarantee the future. The best we can do is size up the chances  calculate the risks involved  estimate our ability to deal with them and make our plans with confidence.
data.author: Henry Ford II

data.quote: Every time I think that I'm getting old  and gradually going to the grave  something else happens.
data.author: Lillian Carter

data.quote: Many live in dread of what is coming. Why should we? The unknown puts adventure into life. ... The unexpected around the corner gives a sense of anticipation and surprise. Thank God for the unknown future.
data.author: E. Stanley Jones

data.quote: I think I look good out there. I'm strong  powerful  and artistic. But I have my doubts as much as anyone.
data.author: Jill Trenary

data.quote: If I ever felt inclined to be timid as I was going into a room full of people  I would say to myself  "You're the cleverest member of one of the cleverest families in the cleverest class of the cleverest nation. ... Why should you be frightened?"
data.author: Beatrice Potter Webb

data.quote: Action will remove the doubts that theory cannot solve.
data.author: Tehyi Hsieh

data.quote: To Death I yield  but not to Doubt  who slays before!
data.author: Edith M. Thomas

data.author: Christian Morgenstern

data.quote: Boredom is the fear of self.
data.author: Comtesse Diane

data.quote: It is not opposition but indifference which separates men.
data.author: Mary Parker Follett

data.quote: Exuberance is beauty.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: Enthusiasm moves the world.
data.author: Arthur James Balfour

data.quote: A man can be short and dumpy and getting bald but if he has fire  women will like him.
data.author: Mae West

data.quote: What a man knows only through feeling can be explained only through enthusiasm.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: My enthusiasms ... constitute my reserves  my unexploited resources  perhaps my future.
data.author: E. M. Cioran

data.quote: I have always had a dread of becoming a passenger in life.
data.author: Margareth II, Queen of Denmark

data.quote: A continued atmosphere of hectic passion is very trying if you haven't got any of your own.
data.author: Dorothy L. Sayers

data.quote: Nothing is so contagious as enthusiasm  it moves stones  it charms brutes. Enthusiasm is the genius of sincerity  and truth accomplishes no victories without it.
data.author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

data.quote: The clue is not to ask in a miserly way-the key is to ask in a grand manner.
data.author: Ann Wigmore

data.quote: Energy is equal to desire and purpose.
data.author: Sheryl Adams

data.quote: What counts is not necessarily the size of the dog in the fight  but the size of the fight in the dog.
data.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

data.quote: All we need to make us really happy is something to be enthusiastic about.
data.author: Charles Kingsley

data.quote: Most great men and women are not perfectly rounded in their personalties  but are instead people whose one driving enthusiasm is so great it makes their faults seem insignificant.
data.author: Charles A. Cerami

data.quote: Winning isn't everything. Wanting to win is.
data.author: Catfish Hunter

data.quote: Vitality! That's the pursuit of life  isn't it?
data.author: Katharine Hepburn

data.quote: In things pertaining to enthusiasm  no man is sane who does not know how to be insane on proper occasions.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: Enthusiasm is the divine particle in our composition: with it we are great  generous  and true  without it  we are little  false  and mean.
data.author: L. E. Landon

data.quote: The great man is he who does not lose his childlike heart.
data.author: Mencius

data.quote: Zest is the secret of all beauty. There is no beauty that is attractive without zest.
data.author: Christian Dior

data.quote: What hunger is in relation to food  zest is in relation to life.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: Wake up with a smile and go after life.... Live it  enjoy it  taste it  smell it  feel it.
data.author: Joe Knapp

data.quote: What one has  one ought to use  and whatever he does  he should do with all his might.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: Let us go singing as far as we go  the road will be less tedious.
data.author: Virgil

data.quote: And whatsoever ye do  do it heartily.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: You will do foolish things  but do them with enthusiasm.
data.author: Colette

data.quote: Whatever you attempt  go at it with spirit. Put some in!
data.author: David Starr Jordan

data.quote: Every man without passions has within him no principle of action  nor motive to act.
data.author: Claude Helvetius

data.quote: What is man but his passion?
data.author: Robert Penn Warren

data.quote: We always attract into our lives whatever we think about most  believe in most strongly  expect on the deepest level  and imagine most vividly.
data.author: Shakti Gawain

data.quote: You can have anything you want if you want it desperately enough. You must want it with an inner exuberance that erupts through the skin and joins the energy that created the world.
data.author: Sheila Graham

data.quote: Only passions  great passions  can elevate the soul to great things.
data.author: Denis Diderot

data.quote: No one has it who isn't capable of genuinely liking others  at least at the actual moment of meeting and speaking. Charm is always genuine  it may be superficial but it isn't fake.
data.author: P. D. James

data.quote: A willing heart adds feather to the heel.
data.author: Joanna Baillie

data.quote: I really do believe I can accomplish a great deal with a big grin. I know some people find that disconcerting  but that doesn't matter.
data.author: Beverly Sills

data.quote: Charm is a cunning self-forgetfulness.
data.author: Christina Stead

data.quote: Charm is the measure of attraction's power To chain the fleeting fancy of the hour.
data.author: Louisa Thomas

data.quote: Pm convinced that it's energy and humor. The two of them combined equal charm.
data.author: Judith Krantz

data.quote: Nothing great in the world has been accomplished without passion.
data.author: George Hegel

data.quote: If you're a champion  you have to have it in your heart.
data.author: Chris Evert

data.quote: Human nature  if it healthy  demands excitement  and if it does not obtain its thrilling excitement in the right way  it will seek it in the wrong. God never makes bloodless stoics  He makes no passionless saints.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: All passions exaggerate  it is because they do that they are passions.
data.author: Nicolas de Chamfort

data.quote: If we resist our passions  it is more from their weakness than from our strength.
data.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: Be still when you have nothing to say  when genuine passion moves you  say what you've got to say  and say it hot.
data.author: D. H. Lawrence

data.quote: The passions are the only orators which always persuade.
data.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: Passion  though a bad regulator  is a powerful spring.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Our passions are ourselves.
data.author: Anatole France

data.quote: People who never get carried away should be.
data.author: Malcolm Forbes

data.quote: This  indeed  is one of the eternal paradoxes of both life and literature-that without passion little gets done  yet  without control of that passion  its effects are largely ill or null.
data.author: F. L. Lucas

data.quote: When the habitually even-tempered suddenly fly into a passion  that explosion is apt to be more impressive than the outburst of the most violent amongst us.
data.author: Margery Allingham

data.quote: Optimism  unaccompanied by personal effort  is merely a state of mind and not fruitful.
data.author: Edward L. Curtis

data.quote: When enthusiasm is inspired by reason  controlled by caution  sound in theory  practical in application  reflects confidence  spreads good cheer  raises morale  inspires associates  arouses loyalty  and laughs at adversity  it is beyond price.
data.author: Coleman Cox

data.quote: The world belongs to the enthusiast who keeps cool.
data.author: William McFee

data.quote: Without passion man is a mere latent force and possibility  like the flint which awaits the shock of the iron before it can give forth its spark.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: If you aren't fired with enthusiasm  you will be fired with enthusiasm.
data.author: Vince Lombardi

data.quote: You've got to sing like you don't need the money. You've got to love like you'll never get hurt. You've got to dance like there's nobody watching. You've got to come from the heart  if you want it to work.
data.author: Susanna Clark

data.quote: When his enthusiasm goes  he's through as a player.
data.author: Pete Rose

data.quote: Every production of genius must be the production of enthusiasm.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: Give me a man who sings at his work.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: A man can succeed at almost anything for which he has unlimited enthusiasm.
data.author: Charles M. Schwab

data.quote: Drama is very important in life: You have to come on with a bang. You never want to go out with a whimper.
data.author: Julia Child

data.quote: The world belongs to the energetic.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The real difference between men is energy.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: A faint endeavor ends in a sure defeat.
data.author: Hannah Moore

data.quote: Flaming enthusiasm  backed up by horse sense and persistence  is the quality that most frequently makes for success.
data.author: Dale Carnegie

data.quote: Success is going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: There is a passion for perfection which you rarely see fully developed  but... in successful lives it is never wholly lacking.
data.author: Bliss Carman

data.quote: Many of the most successful men I have known have never grown up. They have retained bubbling-over boyishness. They have relished wit  they have indulged in humor. They have not allowed "dignity" to depress them into moroseness. Youthfulness of spirit is the twin brother of optimism  and optimism is the stuff of which American business success is fashioned. Resist growing up!
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: If you have the will to win  you have achieved half your success  if you don't  you have achieved half your failure.
data.author: David V. A. Ambrose

data.quote: Someone's always saying  "It's not whether you win or lose " but if you feel that way  you're as good as dead.
data.author: James Caan

data.quote: To bring one's self to a frame of mind and to the proper energy to accomplish things that require plain hard work continuously is the one big battle that everyone has. When this battle is won for all time  then everything is easy.
data.author: Thomas A. Buckner

data.quote: We would accomplish many more things if we did not think of them as impossible.
data.author: C. Malesherbez

data.quote: Faith that the thing can be done is essential to any great achievement.
data.author: Thomas N. Carruther

data.quote: We can accomplish almost anything within our ability if we but think that we can!
data.author: George Matthew Adams

data.quote: Optimism is essential to achievement and it is also the foundation of courage and of true progress.
data.author: Nicholas Murray Butler

data.quote: Morale is the greatest single factor in successful wars.
data.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

data.quote: The will to conquer is the first condition of victory.
data.author: Marshal Ferdinand Foch

data.quote: The real secret of success is enthusiasm. Yes  more than enthusiasm  I would say excitement. I like to see men get excited. When they get excited they make a success of their lives.
data.author: Walter Chrysler

data.quote: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to success is more important than any other one thing.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: It is fatal to enter any war without the will to win it.
data.author: General Douglas MacArthur

data.quote: The measure of an enthusiasm must be taken between interesting events. It is between bites that the lukewarm angler loses heart.
data.author: Edwin Way Teale

data.quote: Enthusiasm for one's goal to lessens the disagreeableness of working toward it.
data.author: Thomas Eakins

data.quote: To burn always with this hard gemlike flame. To maintain this ecstasy  is success in life.
data.author: Walter Pater

data.quote: Every man is enthusiastic at times. One man has enthusiasm for thirty minutes  another man has it for thirty days. But it is the man who has it for thirty years who makes a success in life.
data.author: Edward B. Butler

data.quote: Man never rises to great truths without enthusiasm.
data.author: Vauvenargues

data.quote: Success is due less to ability than to zeal.
data.author: Charles Buxton

data.quote: I rate enthusiasm even above professional skill.
data.author: Sir Edward Appleton

data.quote: He did it with all his heart  and prospered.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: A strong passion for any object will ensure success  for the desire of the end will point out the means.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: What a man accomplishes in a day depends upon the way in which he approaches his tasks. When we accept tough jobs as a challenge to our ability and wade into them with joy and enthusiasm  miracles can happen. When we do our work with a dynamic  conquering spirit  we get things done.
data.author: Arland Gilbert

data.quote: If you're not happy every morning when you get up  leave for work  or start to work at home-if you're not enthusiastic about doing that  you're not going to be successful.
data.author: Donald M. Kendall

data.quote: The method of the enterprising is to plan with audacity and execute with vigor.
data.author: Christian Bovee

data.quote: Do it big or stay in bed.
data.author: Larry Kelly

data.quote: Sometimes success is due less to ability than to zeal.
data.author: Charles Buxton

data.quote: Zeal will do more than knowledge.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Let a man in a garret burn with enough intensity  and he will set fire to the world.
data.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

data.quote: Knowledge is power  but enthusiasm pulls the switch.
data.author: Ivern Ball

data.quote: Through zeal  knowledge is gotten  through lack of zeal  knowledge is lost.
data.author: Buddha

data.quote: I prefer the errors of enthusiasm to the indifference of wisdom.
data.author: Anatole France

data.quote: It is energy  the central element of which is will  that produces the miracles of enthusiasm in all ages. It is the mainspring of what is called force of character and the sustaining power of all great action.
data.author: Samuel Smiles

data.quote: The difference between one man and another is not mere ability ... it is energy.
data.author: Thomas Arnold

data.quote: You see me in my most virile moment when you see me doing what I do. When I am directing  a special energy comes upon me. ... It is only when I am doing my work that I feel truly alive. It is like having sex.
data.author: Federico Fellini

data.quote: Energy  even like the Biblical grain of mustard-seed  will move mountains.
data.author: Hosea Ballou

data.quote: Energy and persistence conquer all things.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Energy will do anything that can be done in this world.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: The only thing that keeps a man going is energy. And what is energy but liking life?
data.author: Louis Auchincloss

data.quote: No one grows old by living  only by losing interest in living.
data.author: Marie Beynon Ray

data.quote: None are so old as those who have outlived enthusiasm.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Years wrinkle the face  but to give up enthusiasm wrinkles the soul.
data.author: Watterson Lowe

data.quote: He fights with spirit as well as with the sword.
data.author: Latin proverb

data.quote: It is fatal to enter any war without the will to win it.
data.author: General Douglas MacArthur

data.quote: Morale is the greatest single factor in successful wars.
data.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

data.quote: The will to conquer is the first condition of victory.
data.author: Marshal Ferdinand Foch

data.quote: The aim of military training is not just to prepare men for battle  but to make them long for it.
data.author: Louis Simpson

data.quote: Wars may be fought with weapons  but they are won by men. It is the spirit of men who follow and of the man who leads that gains the victory.
data.author: General George S. Patton

data.quote: Enthusiasm can only be aroused by two things: first  an ideal which takes the imagination by storm  and sec ond  a definite  intelligible plan for carrying that ideal into practice.
data.author: Arnold J. Toynbee

data.quote: Earnestness and sincereness are synonymous.
data.author: Corita Kent
